Welcome to Uni-Retriever’s documentation!

Note

This project is under active development.

Uni-Retriever is a unified framework for Information Retrieval (IR) Research. It enjoys the merits of the existing open source libraries (e.g. faiss, Anserini) and develops a unified workflow to implement various neural ranking models (Sparse, Dense and the newly proposed Generative). It is highlighted for the following properties:

  1. Ready-to-use. Uni-Retriever efficiently implements the entire IR pipeline: including the data loading, the model training and the model evaluation. You can quickly reproduce the result of any listed models right after downloading the necessary data.

  2. Elastic. The components of Uni-Retriever is carefully designed to be highly extendable and independent with one another. You can focus on developing a specific part (e.g. encoding model) without inspecting details about the others (e.g. implementation of ANN indexes). You can also develop your own model within the Uni-Retriever’s framework by only adding a configuration file and a model’s implementation.

Before you start, make sure you installed the dependencies. You can manually install them,

export CUDA=11.1
conda create -n uni python=3.9.12
conda install pytorch==1.12.1 cudatoolkit=${CUDA} -c conda-forge -c pytorch
conda install faiss-gpu==1.7.2 -c conda-forge
pip install torch_scatter -f https://data.pyg.org/whl/torch-1.12.0+${CUDA}.html
pip install transformers==4.21.3 hydra-core==1.2.0 notebook ipywidgets

Or you can install the conda environment by one line:

conda env create -f environment.yml

Note

Make sure the cudatoolkit version matches your machine!
